3.2.4 - All timber components of noise wall
Detail - Timber treatment shall comply with requirements of the NZ Timber Preservation Council incorporating - MP 3640.
○ All timber shall be branded to NZS3640:2003 and must be treated not less than 2 months prior to use.
Verifying Document - Delivery dockets and supplier data sheet
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Construction
3.2.5 - All timber components of noise wall
Detail - Timber shall have a moisture content less than 18% at time of installation to avoid excessive shrinkage effects.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Timber shall have a moisture content less than 18% at time of installation to avoid excessive shrinkage effects.
Verifying Document - Delivery dockets and supplier data sheet
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Construction

Detail - Ecology and Environmental Manager to approve the removal of existing vegetation prior to site clearance.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ecology & Environmental Manager's Approval
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Construction
4.1.3 - Clearing and Disposal of Existing Vegetation

Detail - The clearing and disposal of existing vegetation, removal and disposal of existing hardstand surfaces, inorganic debris, site preparation spraying, pruning and minor landscape earthworks, and topsoil re-spreading shall fully comply with Section C of NZTA P39:2013.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - After Construction
Detail - Where possible, existing vegetation, excluding pest plant material, that is removed via site clearance shall be converted to mulch and, if required, stockpiled in an appropriate location.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Existing vegetation converted to mulch and stockpiled if required.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - After Construction
4.2.1 - Setting out of Noise wall Posts
Detail - Setting out to follow design coordinates and levels within tolerance as specified in PS 18.5.7 section (e).

Detail - Holes are to be 400mm dia and 2.8m deep

Verifying Document - Shear vane test report
